name: macOS Use
description: Efficient macOS automation via accessibility APIs - element-based interactions, smart filtering, and decoupled actions/observations for minimal context usage

tools.name: open_application
tools.description: Opens or activates an application by name, bundle ID, or path. Returns the app's PID.

tools.name: get_ui_elements
tools.description: Traverses the accessibility tree and returns interactive UI elements with assigned IDs. Use these IDs with click_element/focus_element.

tools.name: get_active_window
tools.description: Returns information about the currently active window including PID, app name, title, and bounds.

tools.name: click_element
tools.description: Clicks an element by its ID (from get_ui_elements). Uses AXPress action when available, falls back to coordinate click.

tools.name: focus_element
tools.description: Focuses an element by its ID. Useful for text fields before typing.

tools.name: click
tools.description: Clicks at raw screen coordinates. Use click_element instead when possible for better reliability.

tools.name: type_text
tools.description: Types text into the currently focused element.

tools.name: press_key
tools.description: Presses a keyboard key with optional modifiers.

tools.name: list_displays
tools.description: Lists all connected displays with their positions and dimensions. Useful for multi-monitor setups.

tools.name: take_screenshot
tools.description: Captures a screenshot with multi-monitor support. Can capture main display, specific display by index, all displays combined, or a specific window.

tools.name: click_element_and_observe
tools.description: Clicks an element and returns the updated UI state. Convenience method combining click_element + get_ui_elements.

tools.name: type_and_observe
tools.description: Types text and returns the updated UI state. Convenience method combining type_text + get_ui_elements.

tools.name: press_key_and_observe
tools.description: Presses a key and returns the updated UI state. Convenience method combining press_key + get_ui_elements.
